column4: I'm trying to compile install a program from a tar.bz2 source file and when i try to do the make command, i get: make: *** No targets specified and no makefile found.  Stop.
You didn't run "./configure" . Before compiling though check that it doesn't exist in the repositories ...
Generally speaking, compile as a very last resort ...
Then read INSTALL or README (make sure you have "build-essential" installed as well )
